multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a single lesion on my left arm that has turned brown and become hard.
How long have you had the lesion for?
The lesions had been slightly pink for several months before turning brown.
Has the lesion changed in size or shape recently?
No, it has not changed in size or shape; it just turned brown and hardened.
Do you have a history of excessive sun exposure or sunburns?
No, I do not have a history of excessive sun exposure or sunburns.
Have you experienced any itching, bleeding, or pain from the lesion?
No, I haven't experienced any itching, bleeding, or pain from the lesion.
Do you have a personal or family history of skin cancer?
No, I have no relevant family or personal history of skin cancer.
Has there been any discharge from the lesion?
No, there has been no discharge from the lesion.
Final Diagnosis: Dermatofibroma
